bug.short_desc: python-matplotlib is failing in tests on aarch64
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
python-matplotlib-1.5.2-0.2.rc2.fc25
http://arm.koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=3665004
It could possibly be due to an assumption about page size (64K vs 4K page sizes). Fedora and RHEL support 64K on aarch64, other distros support 4K
Executing(%check): /bin/sh -e /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.5PdpC5 + umask 022 + cd /builddir/build/BUILD + cd matplotlib-1.5.2rc2 + echo 'backend : TkAgg' ++ getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN + MPLCONFIGDIR=/builddir/build/BUILD/matplotlib-1.5.2rc2 + MATPLOTLIBDATA=/builddir/build/BUILDROOT/python-matplotlib-1.5.2-0.2.rc2.fc25.aarch64/usr/share/matplotlib/mpl-data + PYTHONPATH=/builddir/build/BUILDROOT/python-matplotlib-1.5.2-0.2.rc2.fc25.aarch64/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages + xvfb-run -a /usr/bin/python2 tests.py --no-network --processes=8 --process-timeout=300 ........KKKKKKKK....K..K...K.......K..K...K....K..........K....K..K......K..............K....K...K....K..K..K..K..K..K........K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K...K......K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K...........K..K.....K..K..K..K..K..K.....K...K..K....K.......K......K..K..K..K..K..K..K..K......K..K...K..K...K..K..K...K..K..K....K......K..K...K...K...K....K..K..K...K.......................................SSS..........................SSSSS.S......./builddir/build/BUILDROOT/python-matplotlib-1.5.2-0.2.rc2.fc25.aarch64/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/matplotlib/font_manager.py:1288: UserWarning: findfont: Font family [u'sans-serif'] not found. (In reply to Peter Robinson from comment #0) > python-matplotlib-1.5.2-0.2.rc2.fc25 > > http://arm.koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=3665004 > > It could possibly be due to an assumption about page size (64K vs 4K page > sizes). Fedora and RHEL support 64K on aarch64, other distros support 4K
This is reported upstream to also fail on debian arm64 in the same way: https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/issues/5256
Actually I reported a new issue, specific to 2.0.0b4 which I'm working on right now.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.
python-matplotlib-2.0.0-2.fc26.2 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-4732cdfecb

python-matplotlib-2.0.0-2.fc26.2 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
